titleStmt.title: The triumph of a true Christian described: or An explication of the eight chapter of the Epistle of Saint Paul to the Romans wherein the sanctified sinners heauen vpon earth is layed open, with explication of the comfort of it to as many as are so qualified. Deliuered in sundrie sermons by Edward Elton, Bachelour in Diuinitie, and preacher of Gods word at Saint Mary Magdalens Barmondsey neare London. And now by him published, intending the good and sauing comfort of euery true beleeuing soule that shall please to read it.
titleStmt.author: Elton, Edward, d. 1624.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Field for Robert Mylburne and are to be sold at the great south doore of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Cf. Folger catalogue, which gives signatures: A⁴ B-Lll Mmm⁴.
Variant 1: imprint has "Milbourne"; variant 2: imprint has" Mylbourne".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the great south doore of Pauls
